short_description: This function infers the topic distribution for the input.
long_description: This function is used to output the topic distribution for each document in inputtable. Inputtable contains the documents to be infered and the  modeltable is the output of LdaTrainer. The result is stored in outputtable.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table or view that contains the new documents.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table or view that contains the new documents.

input_tables.name: ModelTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the model table generated by the function.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the model table generated by the function.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the output table that contains the topic distribution of each document in the input table, which the function creates in the database.This table must not already exist.
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output table that contains the topic distribution of each document in the input table, which the function creates in the database.This table must not already exist.

argument_clauses.name: DocIDColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the document identifiers.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the document identifiers.

argument_clauses.name: WordColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the words (one word in each row).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the words (one word in each row).

argument_clauses.name: CountColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the count of the corresponding word in the row, a NUMERIC value.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the count of the corresponding word in the row, a NUMERIC value.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTopicNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of top-weighted topics and their weights to include in the output table for each training document. The value topics must be a positive INTEGER. The default value, 'all', specifies all topics and their weights.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of top-weighted topics and their weights to include in the output table for each training document. The value topics must be a positive INTEGER. The default value, 'all', specifies all topics and their weights.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTopicWordNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of top topic words and their topic identifiers to include in the output table for each training document. The value topic_words must be a positive INTEGER. The value 'all' specifies all topic words and their topic identifiers. The default value, 'none', specifies no topic words or topic identifiers.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of top topic words and their topic identifiers to include in the output table for each training document. The value topic_words must be a positive INTEGER. The value 'all' specifies all topic words and their topic identifiers. The default value, 'none', specifies no topic words or topic identifiers.
